name: Eurofighter Typhoon FGR4
weapons: Mauser BK-27, AMRAAM, Meteor, ASRAAM, Paveway IV, Brimstone
description: The backbone of the RAF. A highly agile multi-role fighter used for Quick Reaction Alerts (QRA) and precision strikes.

name: Apache AH-64D
weapons: 30mm M230 Chain Gun, Hellfire Missiles, Hydra 70 Rockets
description: A lethal attack helicopter capable of destroying armor, personnel, and materiel targets in obscured battlefield conditions.

name: F-35B Lightning
weapons: Internal Cannon, AIM-120D, Paveway IV, SPEAR 3
description: 5th Generation stealth fighter with STOVL capabilities for carrier and land operations.

name: Chinook HC6A
description: Heavy-lift helicopter used for trooping, resupply, and battlefield casualty evacuation.

name: A400M Atlas
description: Strategic and tactical airlift capability, capable of delivering heavy loads to short, unprepared runways.

name: Voyager
description: The RAF's sole air-to-air refuelling (AAR) tanker and also operates as a strategic air transport.

name: RC-135W Airseeker
description: Electronic surveillance aircraft that provides the UK with a world-class ISTAR capability.

name: E-3A Sentry AWACS
description: Airborne early warning and control (AEW&C) platform providing all-weather surveillance and communications.

name: E-7 Wedgetail AEWC
description: The future of the RAF's Airborne Early Warning and Control capability, based on the Boeing 737 Next Generation.

name: BAe Hawk
description: Advanced jet trainer used for preparing pilots for the latest generation of combat aircraft.

name: Puma HC2
description: Medium-lift transport helicopter used for tactical movement of troops and equipment.

name: KC-10A Extender
description: Strategic tanker and transport aircraft, often integrated into joint-force operations.

name: Protector
weapons:
Brimstone missiles: Low-collateral, high-precision strike missiles.
Paveway IV: Laser-guided bombs for versatile target engagement.
